title: Sensyne Health scraps pay policy in major climbdown after backlash
text:
A healthcare technology company backed by discredited stockpicker Neil Woodford has been forced into a humiliating climbdown over boardroom pay.

Sensyne Health apologised to shareholders for not consulting them about director pay and withdrew the remuneration policy, which could have handed chief executive Lord Paul Drayson up to £1.5m in the 12 months to April.

Lord Drayson, who served as defence and then science minister under Tony Blair and Gordon Brown, will receive only nominal pay until then, the company said.

Sensyne’s biggest institutional shareholders will have to sign off on any bonus for the current financial year.
